PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer. If there is any doubt about leaving blank spaces, use extra sheets of paper. If there are not sufficient spaces to answer the questions, don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

(All questionnaires)
- Pioneer diet
- Pioneer schools
- Pioneer churches
- Pioneer recreation and social life
- Pioneer farming experiences
- Folklore in Saskatchewan
- Pioneer health and housing

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

1. Your full name: Alice Gordon
2. Your address: 1375 153 Wrake Rd, Saskatoon
3. Date: January 27, 1946
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Winnipeg, Manitoba
5. What was your father's name and occupation? William Gordon
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): July, 1891
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: Shellmouth, Manitoba
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you have used "I was a small child", etc.) I was a young girl
9. What were your reasons for coming West? - I came with my family
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it?) Through other people
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought it was very good, and they came instead too.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)? I travelled with the family.

13. What means of transportation did you use? Wagon and oxen.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc. We had tents at a place then called Silver Creek, Manitoba. We camped there for a week to rest the cattle. One evening while there, a young man came up and said he was from the North West Mounted Police and wanted to see us. We went with him to his camp and he gave us some food. We were very grateful.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? We stayed at a place near Qu'Appelle, Saskatchewan until we left for the North West Territories. We became Saskatchewan in 1925-6.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? We settled in the area of Qu'Appelle, Saskatchewan.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. We lived in Qu'Appelle, Saskatchewan.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came? We worked on farms and homesteads. We farmed also in the area of Regina, Saskatchewan. We also worked on Lake Diefenbaker.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought it was very good, and they came west too.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)? I travelled with the family.

13. What means of transportation did you use? Wagon and oxen.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.) We had tents all the way. After Yellow River Creek, we camped in a week to reach the cattle. One evening while there, a young man came up and said "Hello." That love had nothing to do with me. We moved on and one of my brothers mentioned a homestead near North West Territorial. He decided to go there in 1905-6.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? We moved to the place called Placer Butte.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? Placer Butte.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. I lived in Town of Weyburn. Then farmed also in the District.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came? I worked as a farmer and then as a teacher. I worked in Provincial Parks and then as a guide for a few years in the Peace River Region. I also worked at Lake Baloo, etc.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES! A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

PLEASE PRINT ALL PROPER NAMES AND PLACE NAMES IN CAPITAL LETTERS. IF YOU ARE NOT SURE THE NAME IS CORRECT AS YOU HAVE GIVEN IT, PLEASE SAY SO. IF YOU WISH TO HAVE SOMEONE ELSE DO THE WRITING FOR YOU, THIS IS QUITE ACCEPTABLE.

1. Your full name:
   Mrs. Alice Vis

2. Your address:
   Wapella

3. Date:
   January 28, 1953

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country of grandparents)
   Wapella

5. What was your father's name and occupation?
   William Farmer

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year)
   1890

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates whenever possible.
   I was in Canada when I was a very little girl.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (If you do not need to answer this question, if you would rather not say how old you are, please say so.)
   I was in my teens.

9. What were your reasons for coming West? (Tell us why you came here.)
   To take up land and farm.

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroads or government information?)
    Through a friend who had been there.

11. Describe your experiences in the early days in Saskatchewan.
    We had to build our own homes from scratch. It was hard work, but we persevered.

12. What were the biggest challenges you faced in settling in Saskatchewan?
    The harsh weather conditions and lack of resources.

13. How did you adapt to the new environment?
    We learned to be self-sufficient and resourceful.

14. What advice would you give to someone planning to settle in Saskatchewan today?
    Be prepared for the challenges and embrace the opportunities.
12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other groups)?
   I traveled with my family.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   We used wagons and oxen to pull them.

14. How did you feel about the journey? What was the most memorable part?
   I felt excited and nervous at the same time. The most memorable part was seeing the vast plains and the beautiful scenery.

15. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada?
   My father did both farming and ranching and forming cattle.

16. What did you like best about living in Western Canada?
   I liked the open spaces and the opportunity to be independent.

17. What did you dislike about living in Western Canada?
   I disliked the isolation and the harsh weather conditions.

18. How did you earn a living after coming to Western Canada?
   After coming to Western Canada, I started working in the mining industry.

19. What did you like best about living in Western Canada?
   I liked the opportunity to work in the mining industry and the chance to make a good living.

20. What did you dislike about living in Western Canada?
   I disliked the long hours and the difficult working conditions.
12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other groups)?
   I traveled with my family.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   Carried luggage on a baby carriage.

14. How did you feel about the trip? (Was it fun, exciting, etc.)
   It was very exciting and enjoyable.

15. How did you feel about the weather?
   The weather was pleasant and sunny.

16. How did you feel about the food?
   The food was delicious and varied.

17. How did you feel about the people you met?
   The people were friendly and welcoming.

18. How did you feel about the overall experience?
   Overall, it was an amazing and unforgettable experience.
